meanings.sent1: The hypotonicity of the solution caused the cells to swell.

meanings.definition: The quality of having reduced muscle tone.
meanings.sent1: Physical therapy can help improve hypotonicity in children with muscle weakness.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noted the hypotonicity in the patient's arms and legs.
meanings.sent3: The hypotonicity of the rubber band made it useless for holding things together.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a hypotonicity that conveyed a sense of calm.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by low osmotic pressure.
meanings.sent1: The hypotonicity in the blood cells indicated a potential health issue.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the hypotonicity of the solution in simple terms.
meanings.sent3: The hypotonicity of the sponge made it absorb water quickly.
meanings.sent4: The hypotonicity of the market led to a decrease in prices.
meanings.sent5: The hypotonicity of the plant cells allowed for easy water uptake.
